entry.title: Jonos International (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Jonos International offered Gucci carrying cases with their Escort portable computers (example pictured) in 1982?

entry.title: Jin Hao (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that swimmer Jin Hao competed in eight events, the most of any participant, during the 2001 National Games of China, causing him to lose 4 kilograms (8.8 lb)?

entry.title: Bdóte (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Bdóte, an area of sacred significance to the Dakota people, centered on the confluence of the Minnesota and Mississippi rivers, was also the site of their forced exile from Minnesota?

entry.title: Summa confessorum (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Thomas of Chobham's Summa confessorum was one of the most copied works on penance in the late medieval period?

entry.title: Heat Flow Experiment (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Apollo 16 Heat Flow Experiment was disabled when astronaut John Young tripped over a cable and tore it from its connector?

entry.title: Jessica Mak (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that for her presentation at the 2008 Game Developers Conference, Jessica Mak simply played music and let go balloons in the audience?

entry.title: South Bellevue station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that completion of South Bellevue station was delayed by more than a year due to the COVID-19 pandemic and a workers' strike?

entry.title: Matei Donici (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Matei Donici, a general in the Imperial Russian Army, secretly wrote poetry with Romanian-nationalist and anti-Russian messages?
